DSS.title: Add missing steps to installation docs
Search bar should be lined up visually with the mathematical header

comments.body: @Phil94comp : thanks!  Yes, you will want to ensure that you have ruby, bundler, lando, and yarn installed, then follow those steps.  When you get to the rake task, it would be as written (`rake dss:servers:start`).  The `dss` part of that command comes from the [rake task namespace in this file](https://github.com/pulibrary/DSS/blob/main/lib/tasks/dss.rake#L3), rather than from the name of the directory.

orangelight.title: Oversize CD Call Number doesn't work in Call Number Browse
Audit the docs directory for accessibility

comments.body:
From @sandbergja is a possible tool that could be used to detect user agents: https://rubygems.org/gems/device_detector. API calls to target. 
Possible calls to restrict in order of impact

1. Staff View (Server Side)
2. Availability on Search Results (JS)
3. Availability on Record Page (JS)
4. Figgy Graphql Lookup Record Page (JS)
5. Request form (Server Side) You need to authenticate to do this so this seems the least impactful. The others all happen everytime you load the page.

pulfalight.title: Make table of contents online toggle persistent.
Base location hint off of Site.
Add location information to each item in the Request Cart

comments.body:
Just looking at this example - https://findingaids.princeton.edu/catalog/MC016_c7860
and the text says view at the Recap which is going to be confusing for researchers since they literally can't. The truck underneath is good but I am concerned about the text
@christinach I see what you mean. What should it say in that case?
Is it possible to note which reading room it would be viewed in? I am not sure how complicated that would be for yall.
So based on repository instead of container location?
Yes that seems as though it would work

comments.body: Reopened because https://findingaids.princeton.edu/catalog/TC040_c01829?onlineToggle=false should have a content warning and does not.
I think this indexed, but did not display - maybe it only displays the `_combined` field if there's something in the `scopecontent` field.
